author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**HAOYUatHZ**
why eth2.0 is using RANDAO instead of RANDAO++(https://www.reddit.com/r/ethereum/comments/4mdkku/could_ethereum_do_this_better_tor_project_is/d3v6djb/) proposed by vitalik?

The timeline is RANDAO -> RANDAO++ -> ETH2.0, isnâ€™t it? RANDAO++ should already exist when eth2.0 design started?

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**HAOYUatHZ**
BTW, is eth2.0 already using   RANDAO+VDF?   seems currently it is still using RANDAO?

author: djrtwo
content:
RANDAO++ looks like a variation to harden RANDAO against last revealed attacks using a proof-of-work. 
There is a variation of RANDAO where the output is put into a VDF (sequential proof of work) and depending on the progress of VDFs is planned to be used eventually in eth2

author: djrtwo
content: these types of protocols rely on assumptions in attacker speed in the sequential proof of work, and thus make the problem hard

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**HAOYUatHZ**
will it be difficult to adding VDF in the future?

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**HAOYUatHZ**
if the beacon chain is already running, would adding VDF require a soft(?) fork?

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**dankrad**
Yes it requires a fork. But several forks of the beacon chain will be required either way
